ArticleTitle.sentence: A distant upstream site involved in the negative regulation of the Escherichia coli ompF gene.

event.clue: A distant upstream site involved in the negative regulation of the Escherichia coli ompF gene.
A distant upstream site involved in the negative regulation of the Escherichia coli ompF gene.

AbstractText.sentence: The two-component regulatory system, OmpR-EnvZ, of Escherichia coli K-12 regulates the expression of the major outer membrane porin protein, OmpF.
OmpR is a DNA-binding protein which acts as both an activator and a repressor to control ompF transcription.

event.clue: OmpR is a DNA-binding protein which acts as both an activator and a repressor to control ompF transcription.
OmpR is a DNA-binding protein which acts as both an activator and a repressor to control ompF transcription.
OmpR is a DNA-binding protein which acts as both an activator and a repressor to control ompF transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: In this article, we describe a new OmpR-binding site that is located between 384 to 351 bp upstream from the ompF start point of transcription.
Inactivation of this site by insertion of a 22-bp fragment prevents the repression of ompF expression conferred by the dominant negative mutation, envZ473.

event.clue: Inactivation of this site by insertion of a 22-bp fragment prevents the repression of ompF expression conferred by the dominant negative mutation, envZ473.
Inactivation of this site by insertion of a 22-bp fragment prevents the repression of ompF expression conferred by the dominant negative mutation, envZ473.

AbstractText.sentence: On the basis of the location of this binding site, the presence of bent DNA in the ompF regulatory region (T.

Mizuno, Gene 54:57-64, 1987), and the fact that mutations altering integration host factor result in constitutive ompF expression (P. Tsui, V. Helu, and M. Freundlich, J. Bacteriol. 170:4950-4953, 1988), we propose that the negative regulation of ompF involves a DNA loop structure.

event.clue: Mizuno, Gene 54:57-64, 1987), and the fact that mutations altering integration host factor result in constitutive ompF expression (P. Tsui, V. Helu, and M. Freundlich, J. Bacteriol. 170:4950-4953, 1988), we propose that the negative regulation of ompF involves a DNA loop structure.
